entry.title: PKU ACM 1009 Edge Detection
entry.content:
这次题目都不想贴了，智商退化了之后有点干不过它。
大意是处理一张图像，每个像素点与周围八个比较，取最大的差值作为该位置的结果值。
考点其实是压缩
给的数据里有10^9这样的变态值。
然而提交后提示running time error。我就日了狗了，反复设几次return后又跳了内存超标的错误。
老子解出来很给面子了啊，别在我做回复训练的时候要求太高。Java还要限制10000KB
TODO 等老了之后或许有时间来优化，目测有这样几个点

1.检测用的二维数组设定固定长宽，不根据输入内容新建
2.点与周围差值比较时新建了8个int，这个应该也可以省
3.可以尝试直接从压缩后的结果开始计算，不考虑展开图像后的对比
entry.summary:

然而提交后提示running time error。我就日了狗了，反

entry.title: 鸡汤001
entry.content:
如果我要把现在这种习惯坚持下去的话，需要不断用鸡汤毒自己。通过这里把幼稚的东西通通写出来，供将来的自己嘲笑，也供别人嘲笑，然后硬着头皮走。

昨天做ACM1009的时候又碰上麻烦了，应该算第一道需要一点点数学思考的题目，不能用单纯的程序方法处理了。
在思考数学解法的时候，脑子一团浆糊，于是就暂时放弃了。那些饿着肚子，超过了预定时间还坚持写了半天的代码也变得毫无用处。情绪怎么也高涨不起来。

想想如果做游戏的话，不但代码可能重新写，连设计也可能不符合要求。到时候不得不提起精神仔细分析状况——判断是改进现在的做法还是另寻途径。
到时候如果抱着现在这样的心态，遇到一点问题就没精神的话，恐怕是没办法继续前进的。不论是判断现状还是寻找新办法，只会原地踏步而已。最后像爆竹一样，只有一瞬间的光亮。
entry.summary:

entry.title: VS自动补全 设置
entry.content:
VS自带的代码补全功能不支持支持跳字输入的情况，比如v3不会匹配到Vector3。因为一直习惯了这样的输入方式，有点不爽，就开始找原因。

在不是很懂的情况多试了一些复选框，Listboxes选项卡的第一个条“Enable Visual Assist Completion……”。
勾上就好了，提示框会忽略顺序，优先在列表里找出顺序符合，匹配字数最多的。原来之前都没勾上，用的全是VS自带的补全XP。

VS自带的攻能名字叫intellisense，智能感知。
Snippet更偏向if(){}else{}一类吧，虽然以前在Sublime上下插件的时候有补全插件用这类名字命名。
entry.summary:
VS自带的代码补全功能不支持支持跳字输入的情况，比如v3不会匹配到Vector3。因为一直习惯了这样的输入方式，有点不爽，就开始找原因。

在不是很懂的情况多试了一些复选框，Listboxes选项卡的第一个条“Enable Visual Assist Compl

entry.title: PKU ACM 1008 Maya Calendar
entry.content:
During his last sabbatical, professor M. A. Ya made a surprising discovery about the old Maya calendar. From an old knotted message, professor discovered that the Maya civilization used a 365 day long year, called Haab, which had 19 months. Each of the first 18 months was 20 days long, and the names of the months were pop, no, zip, zotz, tzec, xul, yoxkin, mol, chen, yax, zac, ceh, mac, kankin, muan, pax, koyab, cumhu. Instead of having names, the days of the months were denoted by numbers starting from 0 to 19. The last month of Haab was called uayet and had 5 days denoted by numbers 0, 1, 2, 3, 4. The Maya believed that this month was unlucky, the court of justice was not in session, the trade stopped, people did not even sweep the floor.
For religious purposes, the Maya used another calendar in which the year was called Tzolkin (holly year). The year was divided into thirteen periods, each 20 days long. Each day was denoted by a pair consisting of a number and the name of the day. They used 20 names: imix, ik, akbal, kan, chicchan, cimi, manik, lamat, muluk, ok, chuen, eb, ben, ix, mem, cib, caban, eznab, canac, ahau and 13 numbers; both in cycles.
Notice that each day has an unambiguous description. For example, at the beginning of the year the days were described as follows:
1 imix, 2 ik, 3 akbal, 4 kan, 5 chicchan, 6 cimi, 7 manik, 8 lamat, 9 muluk, 10 ok, 11 chuen, 12 eb, 13 ben, 1 ix, 2 mem, 3 cib, 4 caban, 5 eznab, 6 canac, 7 ahau, and again in the next period 8 imix, 9 ik, 10 akbal . . .
Years (both Haab and Tzolkin) were denoted by numbers 0, 1, : : : , where the number 0 was the beginning of the world. Thus, the first day was:
Haab: 0. pop 0
Tzolkin: 1 imix 0
Help professor M. A. Ya and write a program for him to convert the dates from the Haab calendar to the Tzolkin calendar.

妈呀有两种历法，一种365天，19个月。前20天每天18个月，最后一个月5天。月份用名字，日子用数字。
另一种历法类似天朝天干计年，两个东西组合起来，各自管自己涨。
输入第一种历法的日期，求出第二种历法的日期。
很简单啦，把第一个转换成天数，再取余两次算出日期，除260取整得年份。

稍微多花了一点时间，忘记字符串对象的==判断是没意义的了，找了一会BUG。骚男你特么要是让老子用个IDE2分钟就能找到。
entry.summary: During his last sabbatical, professor M. A. Ya made a surprising discovery about the old Maya calendar. From an old knotted

entry.title: PKU ACM 1007 DNA Sorting
entry.content:
One measure of ‘’unsortedness’’ in a sequence is the number of pairs of entries that are out of order with respect to each other. For instance, in the letter sequence ‘’DAABEC’’, this measure is 5, since D is greater than four letters to its right and E is greater than one letter to its right. This measure is called the number of inversions in the sequence. The sequence’’AACEDGG’’ has only one inversion (E and D)—it is nearly sorted—while the sequence’’ZWQM’’ has 6 inversions (it is as unsorted as can be—exactly the reverse of sorted).
You are responsible for cataloguing a sequence of DNA strings (sequences containing only the four letters A, C, G, and T). However, you want to catalog them, not in alphabetical order, but rather in order of ‘’sortedness’’, from ‘’most sorted’’ to ``least sorted’’. All the strings are of the same length.

又用我看得很吃力的英文讲了一个冷笑话。
其实就是统计每一位上的字母比后面所有字母大的情况的次数合。例子在题目中有。
·重点是排序方法

然而我用了Java类的功能来解决，所以重点是如何套Arrays.sort()

嗯，直接把统计出来的次数和原生输入顺序转换成5位数字供排序用，然后substring截取。

0004CCCGGGGGGA
0090AACATGAAGG
0113GATCAGATTT
0175ATCGATGCAT
0281TTTTGGCCAA
0302TTTGGCCAAA

仍然是不明原因的WA。

也是服了题目原文，居然用两个点好做双引号的开头，两个单引号做双引号的结尾。成功破坏了MD格式
entry.summary: One measure of ‘’unsortedness’’ in a sequence is the number of pairs of entries that are out of order with respect to each o

entry.title: PKU ACM 1006 Biorhythms
entry.content:
Some people believe that there are three cycles in a person’s life that start the day he or she is born. These three cycles are the physical, emotional, and intellectual cycles, and they have periods of lengths 23, 28, and 33 days, respectively. There is one peak in each period of a cycle. At the peak of a cycle, a person performs at his or her best in the corresponding field (physical, emotional or mental). For example, if it is the mental curve, thought processes will be sharper and concentration will be easier.
Since the three cycles have different periods, the peaks of the three cycles generally occur at different times. We would like to determine when a triple peak occurs (the peaks of all three cycles occur in the same day) for any person. For each cycle, you will be given the number of days from the beginning of the current year at which one of its peaks (not necessarily the first) occurs. You will also be given a date expressed as the number of days from the beginning of the current year. You task is to determine the number of days from the given date to the next triple peak. The given date is not counted. For example, if the given date is 10 and the next triple peak occurs on day 12, the answer is 2, not 3. If a triple peak occurs on the given date, you should give the number of days to the next occurrence of a triple peak.

题目给定了3个数，根据3个输入值，求一个类似公倍数的东西。
相当于3种长度不同积木，各自用同一种积木磊一个柱子，要磊到一个点三者高度刚好一样。要求三个积木的起始高度不同。
然后求指定高度开始，到下一个3种积木高度相等的位置的距离。

.坑点
虽然我解释的时候用的是起始高度，但其实是一种周期
所以如果三个周期的参考时间设在离计算开始时间很后面的话会错过提早完成的情况。
故我开局先把三个参考时间削到计算开始时间之前。
其实很没必要，如果超过3个周期的最小公倍数，if减回来就行了。就像我加了一个if在负值时加回去。然而我自己的测试数据完全没出现那个情况

然后求解方法也是枚举，以其中一个周期做为步长，检测另外两个周期到达这天的时间/周期是否是整数。
.好像很浪费运算量呢，其实只是我不想浪费纸上求解的公式硬套的。
entry.summary: Some people believe that there are three cycles in a person’s life that start the day he or she is born. These three cycles

entry.title: PKU ACM 1002 487-3279
entry.content:
Businesses like to have memorable telephone numbers. One way to make a telephone number memorable is to have it spell a memorable word or phrase. For example, you can call the University of Waterloo by dialing the memorable TUT-GLOP. Sometimes only part of the number is used to spell a word. When you get back to your hotel tonight you can order a pizza from Gino’s by dialing 310-GINO. Another way to make a telephone number memorable is to group the digits in a memorable way. You could order your pizza from Pizza Hut by calling their ``three tens’’ number 3-10-10-10.

The standard form of a telephone number is seven decimal digits with a hyphen between the third and fourth digits (e.g. 888-1200). The keypad of a phone supplies the mapping of letters to numbers, as follows:

A, B, and C map to 2
D, E, and F map to 3
G, H, and I map to 4
J, K, and L map to 5
M, N, and O map to 6
P, R, and S map to 7
T, U, and V map to 8
W, X, and Y map to 9

There is no mapping for Q or Z. Hyphens are not dialed, and can be added and removed as necessary. The standard form of TUT-GLOP is 888-4567, the standard form of 310-GINO is 310-4466, and the standard form of 3-10-10-10 is 310-1010.

Two telephone numbers are equivalent if they have the same standard form. (They dial the same number.)

Your company is compiling a directory of telephone numbers from local businesses. As part of the quality control process you want to check that no two (or more) businesses in the directory have the same telephone number. 

题目坑点就是Output要求在没有重复时输出“No Duplicates”了。是个好习惯！

当然我的代码提示我超时了，用了正则表达式处理

处理过程中遇上一个坑，就是遍历表格删除的顺序问题。天知道java的Hashmap居然会因为遍历过程中长度改变而报错。如果是有序表格的话，从后往前删就好，Hashmap我就没办法了。
于是在统计完重复次数之后，把符合要求的存进数组，不符合的存空。输出时做筛选。
entry.summary: Businesses like to have memorable telephone numbers. One way to make a telephone number memorable is to have it spell a memo

entry.title: PKU ACM 1001 Exponentiation
entry.content:
Problems involving the computation of exact values of very large magnitude and precision are common. For example, the computation of the national debt is a taxing experience for many computer systems.

This problem requires that you write a program to compute the exact value of Rn where R is a real number ( 0.0 < R < 99.999 ) and n is an integer such that 0 < n <= 25.

输入R和N，就R的N次方输出结果。
坑点，头尾的0要去掉。

思路，看到别人的代码用两个while从两头取0，然后输出substring。我却觉得要求去掉头部的0比较适合正则表达式来处理。匹配掉头尾的0，中间用一个括号取出分组。

其实提交没过2333
